channel.title: Control Panel
channel.description:
Welcome to my Server Development thread, in here I will be developing a new control panel with a decent amount of needed features for a server owner, Ive come up with a few ideas already, but I will need some more from you guys. This will be developed to work on a WinterLove 317 based server (I will most likely make more versions for other revisions and bases).
Key Ideas:
[ul][li]Support for a player list.[/li] [li]Ban, Mute, Kick, etc, etc...[/li] [li]Support for use out side of the local computer, meaning you can control your server from a computer across town, or out of the state, or out of the country and what not.[/li] [li]No non needed features that over size it, like NPC and Item lists, or buttons to spawn shit, because that stuff is just un-needed.[/li] [li]Buttons for things like restarting the server, restarting NPC's or Updating the server.[/li] [li]a Command Prompt, to use instead of having to have 2 open for things like debugging messages, or other messages you want sent to the CMD.[/li][/ul]
Not all the things I listed will get in, but I am hoping to create a new control panel as I don't really like the one Roger released, It's to heavy in terns of un-needed shit, and plus I would like to learn more on creating GUI's and how to use those packages.

item.title: Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Well, then I do suggest doing the idea of debugging tab.

That would be great.

Also, if you need me to rename it to PI, just let me know when it’s finished, and I’ll fix it up for you.[/quote]

Ok, thanks.

I’ll try to have a picture or two this week maybe Friday… I am still figuring the package out and how to use it…

Read full topic

item.title: Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I suggest adding multiple panes, for things such as debugging, players, npcs, etc.

Debugging for switching an integer in the server, so you can enable / disable commands, drops, shops, trading, talking, action buttons, etc.

Players for handling all the player information, such as change passwords, kick, ban, demote, promote, jail, perform actions such as force chat, gfx, emote, teleports, etc.

NPCs to handle the npcs, such as drops, (if you take the time to allow drops to be configured through the control panel), text, actions, (making the npc talk/teleport), and other stuff.

Also, I would suggest using a ‘variable/constant’ class to hold all the variables, so it will be easy to configure through out bases.

Such as, when coding in action events, you can make the event load from CONSTANT_CLASS.EVENT_NAME_TO_LOAD. etc.

Then, have the class be configured to locate that method.

Such as PI’s bank method would be c.getPA().openUpBank(); but it could be triggered by, let’s say Config, Confg.bank();

public void bank() {
    dir = "c.getPA().openUpBank();";
}

I probably had multiple errors, but that’s a general idea.[/quote]

Thanks or the ideas, but as I already said this won’t be created with the intention of helping further a persons server development, it will be made strictly for watching over the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Liquid Magic, post:13, topic:371943”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=468004.msg3423981#msg3423981 date=1291764700]

Hypothetically speaking, if this were created, I would want to put a non-playable character somewhere in the server, and then updating, and if I had happened to obtain this tool, all I’d have to do is maximize my server control panel, type in the ID of the NPC, the X and Y coordinates, and press “Update”. Wouldn’t that be useful?

That’s a great idea.
[/quote]
It would be a great idea. I’m not giving any sort of obligation to do it, all I’m saying is that little boys shouldn’t go around fucking with another person’s project. The least any development team/project needs on this site is negative feedback.[/quote]

Thanks for the idea. But I will most likely not add support for things like that, this will be made for, keeping the server clean, rebooting the server, updating the server (restarts blah blah blah, etc, etc, etc…

Read full topic

item.title: Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote="`Pandemonium, post:10, topic:371943"][quote author=PLayRooney link=topic=468004.msg3422564#msg3422564 date=1291626579]
Jmood That guy is just jelous your making something and going to have something better then him and also. Good luck
[/quote]

OYA, I R SO JELUZ OF TEH GUY HOO CAN MAKEZ JFRAMZ

But really, even if you do complete this, it’s pointless to release.[/quote]
Why is it pointless? Are you satisfied yet? You’re looking like a complete, arrogant little pick, while also seeming like one of the most clueless trolls on the internet. It’s obviously not just a simple JFrame created with Netbeans. It also would be a useful tool to use. Hypothetically speaking, if this were created, I would want to put a non-playable character somewhere in the server, and then updating, and if I had happened to obtain this tool, all I’d have to do is maximize my server control panel, type in the ID of the NPC, the X and Y coordinates, and press “Update”. Wouldn’t that be useful?

Read full topic

item.title: Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:2, topic:371943”]This sounds really nice, so the ‘Command Prompt,’ as you said, when you run the server, it will automatically open up the control panel [of course] but the server prompt, that looks like the cmd, will be in a separate tab?
Was that what you meant; if so, that’s very nice.[/quote]

Yeah, I will add a tab or section for the CMD to be placed, instead of having to have both open at the same time.

Davidi2:

Edit the client to have the GUI load from a menu button, then make some custom packets for the data. Otherwise it’s just the same ole, same ole

Thanks for the idea mate.

`Pandemonium:

There really is no need to. I’ve been using the same GUI I made from months ago.

I don’t care if you have been using the same GUI you made months ago… If your just going to hate then don’t even post. I want real criticism not some bullshit “I made this two months ago, it is better then this will be”.

Read full topic
